manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: GIM ARGB LED Light Strip Bar for PC GIM has a great reputation in PC Build. We offer affordable & high quality products for PC Build lovers. DIY your PC, Color your Dream. RGB Light Strip for Game PC Case,Magnetic ARGB LED Strip Lights,Sync Color Changing&Light Speed Led Strip with Controller,5V 3Pin Header Easy to install: double-sided Strong MagnetsWidely Compatible: PC led light strip can connect with SATA, motherboard having 5V 3 Pin rgb Header, and GIM Fans Hub.Color Change & Speed Change Control: Addressable RGB LED Strip for Gaming Case comes with MINI REMOTE.Compatible with ASUS AURA SYNC, Gigabyte RGB Fusion, MSI Mystic Light Sync, etc. Extension cable included for DIY gamers to build up your perfect desktop computerGIFT Choice: The LED Light Strip is a perfect present for any PC owner to bring them hours of pleasure and fun. Note: Want to control led light bar by motherboards. Check first whether there is 5V 3-PIN Digital RGB header (+5V, DATA, N/A, GND) or (V, D, G) on your motherboards.
RGB Sync LED Strip Lights Compatible with ASUS AURA SYNC, Gigabyte RGB Fusion, MSI Mystic Light Sync, etc. Extension cable included for DIY gamers to build up your perfect desktop computer.

Details for Addressable RGB Led Strip Lights Double-sided with Magnets Easy and stable installation to the metal chassis. Widely compatibility 1. Connect to GIM Fan's Hub, fans and led pc strip light can have the same color. 2. Connect 3 pin to Motherboard which has 5V ARGB 3pin header. 3. Connect 3 Pin to Lighting Controller, Lighting Controller to SATA header of your Power Supply Mini Lighting Controller M: Next ModeS: Click to adjust light speed; Hold On for light On / OffC: Click to Switch color; Hold On: adjust brightness of light

reviews.reviewerName: Honest feedback from an honest guyHonest feedback from an honest guy
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Take your computer from drab to fab. It's the missing piece of your PC setup puzzle.
reviews.reviewText: If you're building your ultimate dream computer, the GIM KB-14 Pro Magnetic RGB Light Strip for PC Case is a must-have. When I first decided to build my dream computer, I knew that I wanted a tempered glass side and the ability to change the colors of the components inside. That's where the GIM KB-14 Pro comes in - it's a magnetic RGB light strip that offers full customization of colors based on values assigned through RGB control software like MSI Mystic Light and Corsair iCue.One thing that sets the GIM KB-14 Pro apart is that it's consistent and reliable. I primarily use MSI Mystic Light for things plugged into my JRAINBOW1 & JRAINBOW2 ports on my MSI motherboard, as it works more consistently than Corsair iCue. The light strip adds depth of color and is super easy to install. I love that it's synced to the overall theme of my computer - in this case, Chasing Rainbow - and adds great richness and high levels of brightness to my build.I only put quality RGB elements inside my dream computer, and the GIM KB-14 Pro is no exception. In fact, I liked it so much that I bought three of them! While I only use two light bars in my setup currently, I bought a third one to use elsewhere. These light bars are magnetic and strong enough to be attached both on top and on the bottom of my case, and can also be daisy-chained to other 5V RGB elements.The GIM KB-14 Pro offers multiple means of connecting to different things, including a controller that can be used if you don't have JRAINBOW 5v ARGB connections on your motherboard. I have never had any issues with them, even though they are on for hours, except for the occasional disconnect due to fan vibration.If you're building a dream computer, you want to make sure you're putting the best components in it... and let's face it, RGB lighting is a crucial component of any dream computer and it's what makes your setup pop! The GIM KB-14 Pro Magnetic RGB Light Strip for PC Case is the perfect addition to your build, offering consistent and reliable performance, full customization of colors, and a magnetic hold that won't let you down. Plus, with a price tag of less than $16, it's a steal! I highly recommend this product for anyone looking to add a splash of color or another RGB element to their setup. It's like an all-in-one RGB light that just works!Just be warned: once you see how great the GIM KB-14 Pro looks, you might find yourself wanting to buy a few of them like I did!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great ARGB light at the right price
reviews.reviewText: This product is great. It is very bright, and will plug right into any universal ARGB hub. It is perfect for any RGB PC and is a must have for lighting on a budget

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
reviews.reviewText: These have to be our favorite light bar. Not only do they sync perfectly with the GiM controllers, they work perfectly with SXDOOL fan/controller as in the last three photos we have enclosed. Just about any 6 pin fan and 4 pin led controller should operate these. These are also designed for motherboard sync, but we prefer to use the controllers. So far out of the several of these light bars we have got from Amazon, none have failed and they really put on a light show. To start with we set up a system with SXDOOL fans (this company makes lots of fans). Their controller is set up exactly like the GiM controllers_two 4 pin connections at one end for light bars. Then another system was set up with unique designed fans that have a similar controller. (Photo enclosed), both system of fans work flawlessly with these light bars. When we say 4 pin to controller we are not talking about 12v 4-pin connection. But these are 5v 3pin designed with an extra 4pin only for the controller. We have not tried motherboard sync with them, but in other cases using Asus Aura, now Armory Crate we have had no luck using such programs for any lighting except the motherboard itself. Just to add a side note here, we have never had one light bar out of 14 we purchased to not light up at the first part of the bar. You need a controller for these, else configure Aura Sync or Armory Crate for the # of LED's in the bar. I do know that Aura Sync will only half way light up many the led toys that you can purchase. Sometimes it does not know what RGB or GRB, ect. means. These light bars are ARGB. We highly suggest using a controller to run them, GiM, Cool Moon, SXDOOL, or other to see if the light bar is OK, then you can take it from there using some motherboard software program. Also some those controllers are designed where you can sync them with the motherboard using a specific cable. This we have never tried. But as stated before we have never had one problem out of these light bars. Actually we started purchasing them when they first came out on the market and there was few to none reviews on them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Bright and Pretty. The long boxy shape of the light is very cool and awesome.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Very easy to install just connect to your PSU and it lights up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I just finished building my new PC and wasn't happy with the amount of light on the right side of the case (the Y60 has 50% tempered glass) . Due to the physical design of the case, light strips weren't providing the level of coverage I wanted.So when I saw this light bar, I thought I would give it a try. Given the low price, I was not expecting a lot here and was I pleasantly surprised! It came in a nice box and packaging with some basic printed instructions listing the different connection options.At first, I tried the included controller as that would have been the easiest to hook up in the Y60 case. However, the color options were not ideal even though all I wanted was the bright white (which wasn't an option). So I found a way to run the wire up to the top of the case and around to the mb ARGB port. I used some double stick tape to attach the bar to the side panel glass and that was it.I was very impressed with the brightness and the clarity of the light and as you can see from the before and after pics I have included, it made a huge difference in brightening up the right side of my case!For the price I think this is a great choice for those looking to brighten up the inside of their PC case.
If like me, your mobo is old as dirt and doesn't have rgb headers, this works with the hub by the same brand.Adds a fun little pop, could be brighter. But did exactly what I expected it to.
Die Magneten haften sehr gut. Anschlussoptionen sind auch gegeben. Installation ist sehr einfach. Für den Preis unschlagbar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Led di qualità e la calamita aderisce in modo fantastico
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. La ripresa non rende ma i led sono bellissimi ben fatta e argb 3 PIN 5 V ma trovate un controller SATA se non avete schede madri con argb per cambiare gli effetti , consigliata, la calamita aderisce benissimo promossa a pieni voti

reviews.reviewTitle: Super bright, wish it had a dial to turn it down.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install. My 2 complaints would be the magnetic adhesive was pre installed. I ripped it off and used double sided tape. And it was insanely bright for me... if it had a dial to turn down brightness on that particular piece that would be perfect.
